revision.text:
{{short description|Wikipedia list article}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2020}} This is a list of the '''[[Belgium|Belgian]] Nobel laureates''' {| class="wikitable sortable" !Year!!Laureate!!Field!!Life!!Citation |- | 2013 | [[François Englert]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/2013/englert/facts/|title=François Englert: The Nobel Prize in Physics 2013|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-06}} | Physics | 1932– | "for the theoretical discovery of a mechanism that contributes to our understanding of the origin of mass of [[subatomic particles]], and which recently was confirmed through the discovery of the predicted fundamental particle, by the ATLAS and CMS experiments at [[CERN]]'s [[Large Hadron Collider]]" shared with [[Peter Higgs]] |- | 1977 | [[Ilya Prigogine]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/1977/prigogine/biographical/|title=Ilya Prigogine: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry 1977|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-06}} | Chemistry | 1917–2003 | "for his contributions to [[non-equilibrium thermodynamics]], particularly the theory of dissipative structures" |- | 1974 | [[Albert Claude]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/medicine/1974/claude/facts/|title=Albert Claude: The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 1974|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-06}} and [[Christian De Duve]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/medicine/1974/duve/facts/|title=Christian de Duve: The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 1974|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-06}} | Physiology or Medicine | 1898–1983 (Claude)
1917–2013 (De Duve) | "for their discoveries concerning the structural and functional organization of the cell" with [[George E. Palade]] |- | 1958 | [[Dominique Pire]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/peace/1958/pire/biographical/|title=Dominique Pire: The Nobel Peace Prize 1958|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-06}} | Peace | 1910–1969 | ''No citation'' |- | 1938 | [[Corneille Heymans]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/medicine/1938/heymans/biographical/|title=Corneille Heymans: The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 1938|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-06}} | Physiology or Medicine | 1892–1968 | "for the discovery of the role played by the [[Maxillary sinus|sinus]] and [[Aortic valve|aortic mechanism]]s in the regulation of [[respiration (physiology)|respiration]]" |- | 1919 | [[Jules Bordet]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/medicine/1919/bordet/biographical/|title=Jules Bordet: The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 1919|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-06}} | Physiology or Medicine | 1870–1961 | "for his discoveries relating to [[Immunity (medical)|immunity]]" |- | 1913 | [[Henri La Fontaine]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/peace/1913/fontaine/biographical/|title=Henri La Fontaine: The Nobel Peace Prize 1913|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-06}} | Peace | 1854–1943 | ''No citation'' |- | 1911 | [[Maurice Maeterlinck]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/literature/1911/maeterlinck/biographical/|title=Maurice Maeterlinck: The Nobel Prize in Literature 1911|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-06}} | Literature | 1862–1949 | "in appreciation of his many-sided literary activities, and especially of his dramatic works, which are distinguished by a wealth of imagination and by a poetic fancy, which reveals, sometimes in the guise of a [[fairy tale]], a deep inspiration, while in a mysterious way they appeal to the readers' own feelings and stimulate their imaginations" |- | 1909 | [[Auguste Marie François Beernaert]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/peace/1909/beernaert/facts/|title=Auguste Beernaert: The Nobel Peace Prize 1909|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-06}} | Peace | 1829–1912 | With [[Paul-Henri-Benjamin d'Estournelles de Constant]] (''no citation'') |- | 1904 | [[Institut de Droit International]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/peace/1904/international-law/facts/|title=Institute of International Law: The Nobel Peace Prize 1904|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-06}} | Peace | Founded 1873 | ''No citation'' |- |} ==See also== * [[Science and technology in Belgium]] *[[Belgian literature]] == References == {{Nobel Prizes}} [[Category:Belgian Nobel laureates| ]] [[Category:Lists of Belgian people|Nobel laureates]] [[Category:Lists of Nobel laureates by nationality|Belgian]]
